title: University Physical Education Design Utilizing Big Data-Driven Multimedia Network Teaching Methods

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: A non-degree course for current practitioners, focusing on learning data-driven physical education methods using personal devices

learning_goals: The OpenPose algorithm can be utilized to analyze and provide real-time feedback on learners' exercise postures.

Learners analyze health data (activity levels, fitness metrics, etc.) of 30-something office workers using a big data platform (e.g., AI fitness recommendation system), recommend three personalized physical education materials (exercise routines, nutrition guides, etc.), and achieve over 80% participation rates through a four-week implementation
Learner engagement can be improved by 20% or more using multimedia network instructional methods.
Learners will be guided to maintain at least 90 minutes of weekly exercise based on platform data.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
